page.title: 17CHANGE IN WILLINGDON
page.content: Until the Willingdon By-Pass (the A22) was constructed in 1934, the Eastbourne/London Road ran by way of Wish Hill and Coopers Hill. "The Library Hair Salon" in Wish Hill was a newsagents at one time. Now the only place where you can buy a newspaper in Upper Willingdon is the BP Petrol Station at Willingdon Roundabout (on the A22). The Post Office in Wish Hill used to be a bakery and tea rooms. The previous Post Office was at "Malthouse Cottage", a few doors away. Between the two is "The Malt House", a small restaurant named "The Granary" until last year. "Five Gables", at the junction of Wish Hill and Church Street, now a private residence, was until recently a language school for foreign students.
